metadata.feature_description: Verifies application has Full Trust for deep content indexing operations.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Full Trust enables deep content indexing

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Scheduler in Evoq admin panel
steps.expected: Scheduler page loads showing scheduled tasks including Search: File Crawler
steps.actual: Scheduler page loaded successfully showing all scheduled tasks including Search: File Crawler (ID 20)

steps.action: Viewed Schedule History tab to check recent task executions
steps.actual: History displayed showing various scheduled task executions

steps.action: Clicked on SCHEDULER tab to view File Crawler task details
steps.actual: Search: File Crawler task visible with frequency Every 1 Day and enabled status

steps.action: Clicked Task History icon for Search: File Crawler to view execution logs
steps.expected: Task history shows execution details including Full Trust status
steps.actual: Task history displayed showing: Files encountered: 135, Shallow indexed: 47, Deep indexed: 1, Failed deep indexes: 1. Deep indexing confirms Full Trust is available (no warning message present)

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Security > Security Analyzer to check for Trust Level UI
steps.expected: Check if Trust Level information is displayed in Security settings
steps.actual: Security Analyzer shows various security audit checks but no Full Trust verification UI element exists in this location

observations: Full Trust Verification is a backend-only feature implemented in SearchSpiderHelper.cs (DoesApplicationHaveFullTrust method at line 628-631) which calls SecurityPolicy.HasUnManagedCodePermission()
The feature has NO dedicated UI element for displaying trust level - the suggested UI location 'Admin > Host Settings > Security' does not contain a Trust Level display
Full Trust status is only observable through the FileCrawler scheduled task execution logs in Settings > Scheduler > Task History
When Full Trust is NOT available, the code logs 'logFileCrawlerRequiresFullTrust.Text' warning (FileCrawler.cs lines 72-75) - absence of this warning indicates Full Trust IS available
Deep indexing (using iFilter for content extraction) requires Full Trust; the presence of 'Number of files deep indexed: 1' confirms Full Trust is working
Shallow indexing (47 files) serves as fallback for files that cannot be deep indexed, demonstrating graceful degradation is implemented
